reviews.text: I was quite shocked there. Too many innocent people were victims from the war. But this memorial avoid to be explicit from where or by whom, it is originally caused. At the end of the halls, there are clips of people who were witness, and survived from the bombing. The memorial is nicely done but it would be better if they mentioned "who or what" caused this disaster. so sad... lamentable. (visited couple of years ago). At the park, there is a tombstone for Koreans who forced to come and victimized here. It is really hard to find. If you visit this memorial park, please pray for them too.

Nagasaki National Peace Memorial Hall for the Atomic Bomb Victims (国立長崎原爆死没者追悼平和祈念館) is a commemorative monument in Nagasaki, Japan, situated next to its Atomic Bomb Museum. The Peace Park is nearby. Like its counterpart in Hiroshima, the hall was constructed as a place to remember and pray for those killed by the 1945 atomic bombing, with photos, and memoirs and personal accounts of the event. It also offers information on international co-operation and exchange activities concerning medical treatment for sufferers of nuclear accidents.
I enjoyed this more than the main museum! This space allows for somber reflection, and allows you to connect the the victims and their families

Please go see this Park & Museum, etc. It helps everyone no matter what country we are from to have a better understanding of conflict, arrogance of leadership and war. Spend time to walk around both day and night. They have free guides for the museum, which is very helpful.

It's a memorial built in circular fashion, in remembrance for those who lost their lives along with the list of names known. It is built below the ground level. There is access to elevator(lift) also. Photography is prohibited inside. There are also some video programs.
A big conference center in a easy to find place.
Huge conference center with multiple rooms. Very near to the town center.
Very nice building and area
Serves its purpose well
Big and clean
Very simple, small museum. It is only impressive if you have heard the history of the place from John Hershey's book Hiroshima. Otherwise it will feel lacking. An important stop for history lovers.

This is both sad, poignant and uplifting at the same time providing another opportunity to see the unimaginable terror and awfulness of what happened but also how people made huge efforts to help survivors afterwards. The guide was excellent but it is easy to walk around on your own to learn the story. Sadly this is not visited by many people.
Powerful place.. highly recommend to visit if you are walking in the area.
Amazing story to this museum. Must see.
A place to visit and that makes you to go back in time

Excellent castle and very interesting museum inside. Very thorough English explanations and videos throughout. Lots of stairs to a lovely lookout from the top of the castle. Really enjoyed all of the exhibits and would visit again. There are many beautiful blossoming trees right outside. Highly recommend this spot when visiting Hiroshima!

A very lovely castle. It was interesting to read about the history of the castle and learn about what life was like when it was first built. The view from the top floor was amazing, and they even had maps to show you what you were looking at. The park that the castle is in was beautiful, right beside a river. Would recommended if you love history and architecture!

Quiet little oasis in the middle of a sprawling city.
The grounds are beautiful and quiet enough for you to appreciate a little calm and peace.

The views from the top of the tower are beautiful, and as you admire the history of the tower upon which you have climbed, you can appreciate the beauty of the present city of Hiroshima.

I visited here for a special event. Team lab created amazing illustrations here!! This was sooo stunning!!! You should experience it!! They put a bunch of colorful light balloons in the park! They were so beautiful!! The entrance fee was just 1000 yen. You can take great pictures with the balloons! Of course you can touch them!! There are wall illusion exhibitions! And there is a workshop! You can color on a white paper. And they scan your picture so it will be in the wall digital screen and the mascot move around! You must take your camera and enjoy!!!

Another beautiful place we visited in Hiroshima. More than the castle itself the surrounding gardens with cherry blossoms was the memorable experience in visiting this place. 
Since it's a reconstruction after being destroyed by the a-bomb it had less historical value but the bored from to of the castle are stunning.
Its like a cross between a 1990s game show set and a Wes Anderson Movie. The place is brilliant.

Very engaging two-story museum. There is a climbing area where kids can play and climb through a series of tunnels to the second floor. Everything is hands on so your kids will enjoy trying all the experiments. There is a steam train outside that kids can climb. The museum is free and the Planetarium is very reasonably priced.
Bit old now and could do with a few upgrades. Decent enough though to bring kids

This remains one of my favourite museums with the balance of technology, testimony and artefacts. Unfortunately, they were undertaking significant upgrades during my visit but I look forward to visiting again.
The children's maze is great for the kids to explore!

An unexpectedly beautiful park which has as its centre piece a beautiful Henry Moore sculpture. 
A moder art gallery is also located in the grounds plus lovely walking through the park to ease the day.
Highly recommended

Great place with a good atmosphere. Incredibly helpful advice on the local area and what to eat, where to go, sights to see. Found some great nightlife based purely on the staff recommendations. Superb if, like me, you don't know the area.
Beautiful park. Don't miss out on this if you're in the area. One of the few places you can really have some space from the crowd. No one was there when I went.
Fresh air

Beautiful park. Signs in Japanese. Took a wrong path and went through a graveyard and felt bad and disrespectful. Skybridge was disappointing and unfortunately was there on a monday so center was closed.

The building is nice and easy to get to via street car (tram). I could connect with the art on display but the staff were very friendly and helpful. Bit to much on the building itself. Be great to see more up and coming local contemporary artists

This museum brings in many interesting exhibits and experiences. The architecture in and around the building is really cool. Theres alot of nooks and crannies to explore. The museum does have odd closure days so be sure to check the website ahead of time! And watch out for spider webs during the summer months.
Very short expensive visit. The outside was better than the inside.

It is quite small.  Basically one hall for the main collection, which seems to rotate quarterly, one for the special exhibitions.

Costs around $3 USD for the main hall, another $3 for the special exhibitions.

Keep in mind it is not in a convenient location.  Outside of the main part of town.

I think they could use a new curator.  Some pieces were interesting, some were not.  Seemed like they put some dubious pieces in just trying to keep with the theme of the show.

Overall it was worth the price, but not worth the trip.

Good: Very nice location, on the top of a mountain. The art itself was nice, mostly the special exhibition. 
Bad: Except for the restaurant in the museum, there aren't many options for eating in the area. Not even combini... 
The price for the museum is ok, and there are discounts for students or tourists with the Hiroshima Visit Pass. However the price of the special exhibition is very high.
Interesting concept and lots of things to look at, but not much depth to the exhibits beyond galleries of nearly arranged objects

Small transportation museum.  

Cheep craft place with friendly and kind volunteer people. 

¥510 for an adult and free for children up until junior high school. The models are impressive. Good to combine with the zoo as well.

Very Fun.😉

Written by my son.

乗り物が好きな子供にはたまらない聖地です。
駐車場無料、入館料510円(大人)、中学生以下無料です。
展示を見ない場合は無料で公園に行くことができますが全ての階に乗り物の楽しさがぎゅっと詰まっているので一度は展示を見ることをお勧めします。
晴れの日は無料の公園に電動カート(1回100円)、面白自転車(子供用補助輪付き自転車あり)が30分100円、自分でこげない子供は親の分だけお金を払うシステム。
うちの子供は電車が大好きなので本当に一日楽しめました。

車で行きましたが、駐車場無料なのは助かります。予想していたよりも楽しめました。
天気がよく、日曜だったのもあり、結構家族連れで訪れる人が多かったみたいです。行った時間が少し遅く、人も多かったこともあり、自転車には乗れませんでした。
今度はもう少し早く行きたいと思います。

残念な点は、レストランが中に無い、食べ物を持っていっても、飲食可能なスペースがかなり限られている点です。展示物があるので、飲食可能なスペースとそうでないスペースを分ける必要はあると理解しますが、もう少し広ければ助かります。

I love cars and this might be not the typical place for tourist, but I am so glad and excited to be able to do the museum tour with guide that explained in English, and also to tour around the production plant. Museum and plant tour of Mazda seems to be well prepared and it was a pleasant experience visiting. Of course this need to takes into account that I like cars a lot.

A great visit to the Mazda Museum!  The museum is well laid out and provides one with Mazda history and innovation over the years.  A walk through a portion of the assembly line was the highlight of the tour.

Free and cool stuff available but no time to see it. Need to book it in at least a day in advance on line. When you get there a bus takes you from head office to the museum and the guide walks you through each stage and tells you about various things but you have no time to stop and read the information boards or check out the displays because another group is on it's way through and you must be rushed on ahead.
We were given a nice gift at the end of the tour which was completely unexpected and lovely but not enough time to check out the gift shop. Would have loved another half hour or so just to be able to wander through a little slower and read some of the amazing info plaques and truly admire the displays.
Definitely go here when in Hiroshima. Remember to book in advance. Incredibly kind staff and interesting your - you get to see the production facility!!

For those who love cars especially Mazda brand. The museum takes you back to its early origin, the technological evolution and how it expands to become a major auto brand globally today. Please make advance reservation to visit the museum at least one day in advance.

Beautiful garden! We dropped by on our way to the station, and it was well worth the visit. It's very cheap to get in, and it's so gorgeous. There is a lot to see, and many places to sit and enjoy the view. We only had about 40 minutes to enjoy the park as we had to catch our train, we could have easily spent over an hour here. They also have a little tea shop on site.

Superb Japanese garden. Very nice to walk around. It is very peaceful and serene. Definitely a must see while in Hiroshima. Lots of Koi fish and turtles in the pond. Lovely place for kids, but make sure to hold their hands while they cross the little bridges as they have no railings. 10/10 place to visit.
Beautiful garden samurai style. Come enjoy the beautiful and quiet. Very relaxing. The have Easter toilets and a little gift shop. Definitely worth the visit.

Beautiful garden and views. Really enjoyed touring the garden. The Sakura flowers in the spring are a nice touch. Admission charge is very reasonable, 260 yen for adults. Definitely recommend visiting for some nice and peaceful scenic views. Takes about and hour to tour the whole garden.

Beautiful garden in Hiroshima, from what I could tell most was rebuilt in the 70s and has had a lot of time to flourish since then. Very beautiful sights and informative plaques with interesting pieces of history dotted across the grounds. Friendly staff could be seen maintaining the garden during my time there. The best part was the fish and turtles coming right up to the waterline to say hello!
Awesome!  Cozy upstairs eatery with great food and a charming helpful staff.  We asked for recommendations, and everything we got was tremendous! Dōmo arigatōgozaimashita!!
Great food, very cosy (and a little eccentric), friendly staff. English menu available. Definitely recommended.
Delicious, very affordable food and drinks and the best funky atmosphere, and patronized by a cool artistic crowd. Owner is a Japanese avant-garde accordionist. I mean, what more could you ask for?
What a great bar. Amazing atmosphere awesome interior and the BEST white Russians!
Not what we expected. One of the most weirdest places we ever visited. Food was below expectations.

Absolutely incredible gem of a find! Came here with my mother and grandmother on their visit to Japan and both agree it was the highlight of their trip. The owners were delightful and super excited to share their delicious food and good laughs with us foreigners. Even the “regulars” joined in the banter. It’s a tiny little place but it definitely packs a punch! とても楽しい時間です！

After reading the great reviews online my husband And I waited outside their door for 30 mins awaiting our turn.There were 2-5 locals who just cut the line ( twice!) and entered before us. The owner made no effort to help us or accommodate us. Very disappointing!

Best Okonomiyaki we had in Japan, very tasty and made right in front of us! Wonderful atmosphere, people were so incredibly friendly, ate while talking (owner speaks some English) and laughing so much. I can’t recommend enough, if you’re in Hiroshima it’s well worth a visit!

Extremely negligent staff. We were shoved out of the line and a few locals went in even when they came later than us (after waiting outside for 30 minutes). The owner was an accomplice and did not say anything as well. If you are not Japanese, do not bother with this horrible place. Spend your money elsewhere.
A fun atmosphere with great food! You'll feel like a local eating here, and it's very convenient to get to the train station!

We ordered pizza and an oyster dish. The oyster dish was really good. The pizza had the typical Italian style with a Japanese twist in terms of the toppings.
The service is great and very quick.
It has a stunning view of the river which makes it very relaxing to have lunch or dinner overlooking the river. They do have a few outdoor tables which is where I would recommend to sit to enjoy the beauty of the area.

Great spot next to the river and close to a lot of key sites around Hiroshima city. It’s also across from the river boat terminal. The views from the cafe are excellent especially on a nice day where they can open the windows and one can sit outside. The food and drinks were delicious and served in a timely manner. The staff was also helpful and spoke English if needed.

Perfect little place next to the river. Great views.
Freshly made orange juice available. Nice tea too.
English menu is available. Outdoor seating is nice and charming on a sunny winter day. 
Waitresses can speak a little bit of English so that helps a lot.

Cute little cafe and super convenient location only a 2 minutes walk from Peace Memorial Museum. The staff is really nice! The food was great! It was set at a very good price as well. Their lunch set is definitely worth it!

We enjoyed perhaps the best pizza we've ever had here. The atmosphere was lovely and even though it was February, we loved sitting outside and enjoying homemade gingerale. Staff were lovely and we would highly recommend this little spot for either a sit in pizza or take away!
Very good and authentic Indian food, friendly service and nice ambience. Had a great dinner.
Friendly staff..very tasty indian food..t quality..worthy pricing...best indian restaurant in hiroshima.

Good food at a reasonable price and great location near the memorial park and shopping arcade. It's on the 4th floor just around the corner from Tully's coffee and the Adidas store. The menu is in English as well as Japanese so it's easy to order.

At some point in the last few years they've moved from around the corner - they used to have a ground floor restaurant with a bit more character, now they're on the fourth floor. I think I preferred the food slightly too when they were in their former venue, but it is still reasonably good.
Tasty vegetable Biryani.

Great lunch! Very good flavors and the Nan is superb 😊
Definitely worth a visit when your around Hiroshima.

Incredible Indian food! You can notice the small Japanese elements like the salad dressing and sticky jasmine rice. They have minimal use of dairy which makes the meal much easier to eat. The seasame naan was very cool and the soy milk mango lassi is a must try!

I live in NYC and am visiting Japan. I wanted a break from Japanese food and stumbled onto this place from google and I’m so glad I did! This was the best meal I ate and Hiroshima and the best Indian food I’ve ever had. I wished I was staying an extra day so I could go again. Great service and prices as well. Highly recommend!!
Delicious food and fantastic service. Highly recommended.
Didn't like it at all. Utter disappointment! Naan was good though.

Beautiful garden! We dropped by on our way to the station, and it was well worth the visit. It's very cheap to get in, and it's so gorgeous. There is a lot to see, and many places to sit and enjoy the view. We only had about 40 minutes to enjoy the park as we had to catch our train, we could have easily spent over an hour here. They also have a little tea shop on site.

Superb Japanese garden. Very nice to walk around. It is very peaceful and serene. Definitely a must see while in Hiroshima. Lots of Koi fish and turtles in the pond. Lovely place for kids, but make sure to hold their hands while they cross the little bridges as they have no railings. 10/10 place to visit.
Beautiful garden samurai style. Come enjoy the beautiful and quiet. Very relaxing. The have Easter toilets and a little gift shop. Definitely worth the visit.

Beautiful garden and views. Really enjoyed touring the garden. The Sakura flowers in the spring are a nice touch. Admission charge is very reasonable, 260 yen for adults. Definitely recommend visiting for some nice and peaceful scenic views. Takes about and hour to tour the whole garden.

Beautiful garden in Hiroshima, from what I could tell most was rebuilt in the 70s and has had a lot of time to flourish since then. Very beautiful sights and informative plaques with interesting pieces of history dotted across the grounds. Friendly staff could be seen maintaining the garden during my time there. The best part was the fish and turtles coming right up to the waterline to say hello!
